image.altText: A street view of Jetty Road at Glenelg showing new paving.

props.synopsis: Traders along one of Adelaide's most popular beachside dining and retail strips have welcomed the reopening of roads to traffic, but say recovery will take time.

title.children: Jetty Road reopens after businesses hit hard by roadworks

image.altText: Blue entrance signs flank both sides of a road into the Port Willunga Tourist Park

props.synopsis: Police are at the scene of a suspicious death of a man at the Big 4 Port Willunga Tourist Park at Aldinga in Adelaide's south where a man was found dead inside a cabin.

title.children: Police investigate suspicious death at Adelaide holiday park

image.altText: Police crime scene tape and a police van on a suburban street

props.synopsis: A 42-year-old man has been charged with murder after a woman was found dead in a home in Adelaide's northern suburbs on Sunday night.

title.children: Man charged with murder after woman's death in Adelaide's northern suburbs

image.altText: A hand reaches for bunches of white grapes on a vine.

props.synopsis: After 20 years, three senate inquiries and an independent review, the sale of wine grapes will be regulated by a mandatory code of conduct, but growers say it might be too late.

title.children: Long-awaited mandatory wine industry code of conduct too late for growers

image.altText: An action shot of a dark-haired player in a Crows jumper seizing the football and looking downfield.

props.synopsis: A digital marketing agency run by a former AFL star has wiped its millions in debt through an insolvency process, only to open under a new ABN days later. Former staff were left without a job and almost $450,000 in unpaid entitlements, but it's within the bounds of the law and leaves taxpayers footing the bill.

title.children: Insolvent firm run by ex-AFL star wipes millions in debt via 'legal phoenixing'

image.altText: A fisher along the South Australian coast.

props.synopsis: Some recreational fishing restrictions initially put in place to protect fish stocks impacted by South Australia's algal bloom have now been eased.

title.children: Early Christmas gift for recreational fishers as some restrictions ease

image.altText: A woman in a white shirt posing for a photo on a street.

props.synopsis: Jessica Seage fought for six years for the man who raped her to be convicted. Experts say her experience is a stark example of how perpetrators abuse the system to inflict more pain on their victims.

title.children: Fight to close 'loophole' after DV offender charged interstate while on bail

image.altText: A  large,  white kangaroo lies on the dry, brown grass.

props.synopsis: White western grey kangaroos are a popular sight in a small wildlife park nestled near the South Australia – Victoria border and some are now being sold.

title.children: Rare white kangaroos to be sold to prevent overcrowding at wildlife park

image.altText: Brendon McCullum walks with his head down

props.synopsis: Losing an Ashes Test series in Australia is nothing new for England, but finally the Bazballers are looking inwards after a stirring end to the Adelaide Test.

title.children: Bazball finally admits its failings, albeit far too late

image.altText: Hole smashed in car windscreen.

props.synopsis: Scientists were hoping an object that smashed the windscreen of a self-driving car in October was a meteorite, but SA Museum's investigation says it remains a mystery.

title.children: Object that smashed windscreen unlikely to be anything 'from space'

image.altText: A woman in waders with a pink hat holding up a turtle near a lk

props.synopsis: A team of environmental experts, Indigenous rangers and conservation detection dogs is working on recovering the population of native freshwater turtles.

title.children: Detection dogs part of fight to protect native freshwater turtles

image.altText: A sign with blue text that says Bedford.

props.synopsis: Creditors have voted to support the sale of Bedford to NDIS provider The Disability Trust, which would guarantee the jobs of 1,100 workers.

title.children: Creditors vote in favor to sell Bedford to NDIS disability provider

image.altText: A composite image showing a woman on the left and a man on the right with a dark background. Both are smiling

props.synopsis: As the political year winds up, Premier Peter Malinauskas and Liberal leader Ashton Hurn have much to contemplate over their Christmas lunch.

title.children: Christmas anxiety, political hubris and an upcoming state election

image.altText: A police officer uses a metal detector wand on a person wearing a hoodie with their arms up, inside a train station

props.synopsis: The Adelaide Railway Station is the latest location to be declared a public precinct, giving police extra powers to search people or order them to leave.

title.children: Adelaide Railway station joins list of declared public precincts

image.altText: Two surgeons wearing protective clothing undertake an operation.

props.synopsis: Doctors say they are forced to delay some procedures due to the risk of serious consequences for patients on Ozempic-like drugs.

title.children: Doctors turn Ozempic patients away from surgery due to extra risks

image.altText: A concept design of a golf course with trees and a city in the background and sunset sky

props.synopsis: The South Australian government has released plans for North Adelaide's public golf course redevelopment confirming that nearly 600 trees will be cut down, not the thousands previously claimed by the Liberals.

title.children: Government reveals golf course tree losses as Liberals revise stamp duty policy

image.altText: a climbing graph overlay on a person covered with measles

props.synopsis: The number of measles cases nationwide is now approaching triple the number of cases reported in 2024 as outbreaks continue around the world.

title.children: Measles cases triple in Australia as global outbreaks continue

image.altText: aerial view of a nuclear plant with three main multistoried white buildings with causeways surrounding a large pool on the coast

props.synopsis: Japan has taken the final step to allow the world's largest nuclear power plant to resume operations with a regional vote in Niigata prefecture.

title.children: Japan prepares to restart world's biggest nuclear plant, 15 years after Fukushima

image.altText: Pam Bondi speaking at a press conference.

props.synopsis: Two congressmen say they will recommend United States Attorney-General Pam Bondi be held in contempt of Congress for not releasing all of the Epstein files by the legal deadline.

title.children: US attorney-general faces contempt push over Epstein files

image.altText: A woman in a white shirt posing for a photo on a street.

props.synopsis: Jessica Seage fought for six years for the man who raped her to be convicted. Experts say her experience is a stark example of how perpetrators abuse the system to inflict more pain on their victims.

title.children: Jessica was raped by her husband. It took six years to finally secure a conviction

image.altText: A man's hand holds up a flat, silver button battery between his thumb and forefinger. He can be seen standing out of shot.

props.synopsis: The Federal Court orders the fashion retailer to pay $14 million in fines after it was taken to court by the Australian Competition and Consumer Commission.

title.children: City Beach fined $14m over 'pervasive' button battery safety failures

image.altText: Climate Change Minister Chris Bowen

props.synopsis: Chris Bowen makes a long-anticipated announcement about reserving a portion of gas on the east coast for domestic use after a cabinet meeting.

title.children: Government announces domestic gas reservation scheme in bid to lower costs

image.altText: Greyhound trainer in a fluoro vest being interviewed on a race track

props.synopsis: Victorian trainer Gerry Orr has received a six-year ban for procuring performance-enhancing drugs after he inadvertently alerted stewards by giving authorities his mobile phone.

title.children: Greyhound trainer banned after investigator finds messages to 'Anabolic Jim'

image.altText: Prince William and son George smile whilst volunteering at homelessness charity.

props.synopsis: From America, the Duke and Duchess of Sussex have also sent out their Christmas wishes on Instagram.

title.children: Prince William and son George volunteer at homelessness charity

image.altText: A woman in a blue top laughing outside on a rooftop in a city.

props.synopsis: Artists like Stella Donnelly are searching for ways to cut waste and make production of their albums environmentally friendly.

title.children: Is buying vinyl records bad for the environment?

image.altText: Nigerian school children put their hands up smiling in a car.

props.synopsis: No group has claimed responsibility for the November 21 abduction of more than 300 children and staff from a Nigerian Catholic school.

title.children: Children and staff abducted from Nigerian school released

image.altText: A man and a teenager with dark hair, in front of a laptop.

props.synopsis: Pulled out of class, held back after school and forced to prove they're not AI cheats, students say NSW high schools are pitting them against faulty AI detectors.

title.children: High schools demand students prove they are not AI cheats

image.altText: A close-up of a hand holding a spray can close to a wall.

props.synopsis: A Coolum Beach man is charged with 25 counts of wilful damage following a spate of antisemitic graffiti incidents.

title.children: Queensland man arrested following dozens of antisemitic graffiti offences

image.altText: A sign saying Gosford Police Station

props.synopsis: A 20-year-old who allegedly tried to organise a racial hatred event at Cronulla on the same day as the Bondi Beach terrorist attack is refused bail.

title.children: Man accused of planning racial hatred event at Cronulla refused bail

image.altText: Albanese for Tingle column

props.synopsis: The ABC's political reporters, commentators and broadcasters reflect on what defined the year in politics.

title.children: A triumphant election year for Labor ends on less stable ground for both parties

image.altText: A robot in a lab that looks human-like holds an orange.

props.synopsis: What makes the AI-driven stock market bubble unique in history is that if it's not a bubble, the impact on humanity could be far more challenging than any previous technology.

title.children: Between AI and humanoid robots, we could be at a turning point in history

image.altText: A satellite image of the tropical low

props.synopsis: Perth is expected to hit a high of 41 degrees on Christmas Day with the Cocos (Keeling) Islands bracing for a tropical cyclone that could intensify to a category two system.

title.children: Festive season to bring Perth heatwave, Indian Ocean cyclone

image.altText: Three young people standing in a courtyard with serious looks on their faces holding a protest sign

props.synopsis: A University of Wollongong student says she left the institution after being unable to complete core subjects due to course cuts.

title.children: University accused of 'false advertising' after cuts disrupt degrees

image.altText: A man in front of a poster of a scary clown in a suit.

props.synopsis: James Ransone, an actor best known for playing Ziggy Sobotka in The Wire and also starring in It: Chapter Two, has died, according to LA medical authorities.

title.children: The Wire actor James Ransone dies at age 46

image.altText: Danielle has blond hair wearing a blouse, and Jess, brunette wearing jeans jacket standing with arms around each other

props.synopsis: Despite giving an FBI interview and victim statement, Epstein survivor Jess Michaels finds no trace of her evidence in the vast trove published online.

title.children: 'Another level of betrayal': Survivors search the Epstein files to find nothing
